conclusion: To predict which container the liquid will flow into, analyze the paths of the liquid from each source and trace their trajectories step by step.
The green liquid flows downward from A.
The green liquid hits the green diagonal baffle and is redirected to the left.
The green liquid continues downward and flows into Container H.
The yellow liquid flows downward from B.
The yellow liquid hits the yellow diagonal baffle and is redirected to the left.
The yellow liquid continues downward and flows into Container G.
The orange liquid flows downward from C.
The orange liquid hits the orange diagonal baffle and is redirected to the right.
The orange liquid continues downward and flows into Container F.
The pink liquid flows downward from D.
The pink liquid hits the pink diagonal baffle and is redirected to the left.
The pink liquid continues downward and flows into Container E.
Final Answer: Source A flows into Container H, Source B flows into Container G, Source C flows into Container F, and Source D flows into Container E.
